raytrace1.cpp

This is an example of how to use the CRayTrace::traceLCMS().
Note:
This example is obsolete;
use the method MConf::CStconfig::getRayEntryPoint() and MConf::CStconfig::xyz2mag();
or MConf::C3dMesh::M3DgetRayEntryPoint() and MConf::C3dMesh::M3Dxyz2s()
See also:
raytrace2.cpp
#include <stdlib.h>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <time.h>

#include "CRayTrace.h"

#include <iostream>

const double   pi = 3.14159265358979323846;
const double   degree = pi/180;

double epsA=1e-4;
double epsTrunc=1e-5;

//*****************************************************+
int main()
{
  using namespace MConf; // bad style of using 'using namespace'
  using namespace std;    
  
  CRayTrace magConf;
  if(!magConf.load ("w7x-sc1.bc")) exit(1);   // exit with error if not OK
//  mConf.load("X:/w7as/neocl/config/w7x-sc1.bc");        // for Windows
//  mConf.load("/afs/ipp/w7as/neocl/config/w7x-sc1.bc");  // for Linux

  magConf.truncate(epsTrunc);
  magConf.setAccuracy(epsA);

  clock_t tStart = clock();

  Vector3d r0=7, r1=1,                  // 1st and 2nd point of the ray
           entrypoint,exitpoint;
// Find entry and exit points of the ray into and from plasma
  int rcode = magConf.traceLCMS(r0,r1,entrypoint,exitpoint);
  if(rcode<0) exit(1);   // exit with error if ray does not hit plasma

  Vector3d rd = exitpoint-entrypoint;   // direction of the ray
  rd /= rd.abs();                       // normalize
  double L1=(entrypoint-r0).abs();      // distance from start to first intersection with LCMS
  double L =(entrypoint-exitpoint).abs(); // length of the segment (entrypoint-exitpoint)
  int i,maxPnt = 20;
  double dl = L/(maxPnt-1);

  cout <<" len[m]         s            reff[m]     x,            y,          z "  <<endl;
  cout.precision(4);
  cout.setf(std::ios::scientific);

  for(i=0; i<maxPnt; i++) {            // move along the ray
    Vector3d r = entrypoint + i*dl*rd; // point of the segment (entrypoint-exitpoint)
    Vector3d booz = magConf.xyz2mag(r); // transform to magnetic(Boozer) coordinates
    Vector3d b = magConf.getBcyl(); // magnetic field
    double s = booz[0];             // normalized flux
    double ita = magConf.iota(s);   // iota
    double lng = L1+i*dl;           // length from r0 to r
    double reff = magConf.r(s);
    cout << lng <<"  "<< s<<"  "<< reff <<"  "  <<  r   <<"  " <<endl;
  }

  cout << "time=" << double(clock() - tStart)/CLOCKS_PER_SEC <<"\n";
  return 0;
}
